sen.j: 性空（しょうくう、延喜10年（910年） - 寛弘4年3月10日 (旧暦)（1007年3月31日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Shoku (910 - April 6, 1007) was a monk of Tendai sect of Japanese Buddhism in the mid Heian period.
Shoku (910 - April 6, 1007) was a monk of the Tendai sect of Japanese Buddhism lived in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 単語登録を参考に天台宗に冠詞をつけました。"lived"を追加しました。
sen.e: Shoku (910 - April 6, 1007) was a monk of the Tendai sect of Japanese Buddhism lived in the mid Heian period.
His father was Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Yoshimoto TACHIBANA.
His father was Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Yoshimoto TACHIBANA.
His father was Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Yoshimoto TACHIBANA.
Shoku's secular name was TACHIBANA no Yoshiyuki.
Shoku's secular name was TACHIBANA no Yoshiyuki.
Shoku's secular name was TACHIBANA no Yoshiyuki.
He was born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.
He was born in Kyoto.

sen.j: 書写上人とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: He is also referred to as Shosha Shonin (High Priest of transcription by handwriting).
He was also referred to as Shosha Shonin (High Priest).
sen.cmt: 動詞を過去形にしました。「書写」は呼び名なので訳す必要はないと思われます。
sen.e: He was also referred to as Shosha Shonin (High Priest).

sen.j: 36歳の時、慈恵大師（元三大師）良源に師事して出家。
sen.e: At the age of 36, he entered into priesthood under Jikei Daishi (Gansan Daishi) Ryogen.
At the age of 36, he entered into priesthood taking Jikei Daishi (Gansan Daishi) Ryogen as his teacher.
sen.cmt: 「師事して」を具体的に書き換えました。
sen.e: At the age of 36, he entered into priesthood taking Jikei Daishi (Gansan Daishi) Ryogen as his teacher.

sen.j: 日向国霧島山や筑前国脊振山で修行した。
sen.e: Shoku was trained on Kirishima Mountain in Hyuga Province and on Mt. Sefuri in Chikuzen Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Shoku practiced asceticism on Mt. Kirishima in Hyuga Province and Mt. Sefuri in Chikuzen Province.
sen.cmt: 「修行した」を単語登録を参考に書き換えました。山の記載をMt.で統一しました。後半のonを削除しました。
sen.e: Shoku practiced asceticism on Mt. Kirishima in Hyuga Province and Mt. Sefuri in Chikuzen Province.

sen.j: 966年（康保3年）播磨国書写山に入山し、国司藤原季孝の帰依を受けて圓教寺（西国三十三ヶ所霊場の一つ）を創建。
sen.e: In 966, he entered Shosha-zan Mountain in Harima Province, and accepting the conversion of Kokushi (provincial governor) FUJIWARA no Suetaka to Buddhism, founded Engyo-ji Temple (one of the thirty-three sacred grounds in Saigoku [western part of Japan]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He entered Mt. Shosha in Harima Province in 966, and founded Engyo-ji Temple (one of the thirty-three sacred grounds in Saigoku [western part of Japan]) after accepting the conversion of Kokushi (provincial governor) FUJIWARA no Suetaka to Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 書写山をMt.でかきかえました。年号は入山を示すと思われるので位置を移動，多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He entered Mt. Shosha in Harima Province in 966, and founded Engyo-ji Temple (one of the thirty-three sacred grounds in Saigoku [western part of Japan]) after accepting the conversion of Kokushi (provincial governor) FUJIWARA no Suetaka to Buddhism.

sen.j: 花山法皇・源信_(僧侶)（恵心僧都）・慶滋保胤の参詣を受けた。
sen.e: The Temple was visited by Cloistered Emperor Kazan, Genshin (monk) (Eshinsozu), and YOSHISHIGE no Yasutane.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Cloistered Emperor Kazan, a monk Genshin (also called Eshinsozu), and YOSHISHIGE no Yasutane visited the temple.
sen.cmt: 受動態から能動態へ書き換えました。
sen.e: The Cloistered Emperor Kazan, a monk Genshin (also called Eshinsozu), and YOSHISHIGE no Yasutane visited the temple.

sen.j: 980年（天元 (日本)3年）には蔵賀とともに比叡山根本中堂の落慶法要に参列している。
sen.e: In 980, Shoku attended the rakkei hoyo (a memorial service to celebrate the construction of a temple) of Konpon-chudo Hall of Mt. Hiei with Zoga.
In 980, along with Zoga, Shoku attended the rakkei hoyo (a memorial service to celebrate the construction of a temple) of Konpon-chudo Hall of Mt. Hiei.
sen.cmt: 文後半に前置詞が多くわかりづらいため，蔵賀の位置を前に移動しました。
sen.e: In 980, along with Zoga, Shoku attended the rakkei hoyo (a memorial service to celebrate the construction of a temple) of Konpon-chudo Hall of Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 早くから山岳仏教を背景とする聖（ひじり）の系統に属する法華経持経者として知られた。
sen.e: From early on, he was known as a Hokkekyo jikyosha (devotee of the Lotus Sutra) belonging to the lineage of hijiri (wandering monk), who had a background of Mountain Buddhism, and he is told to have experienced many miracles while he was alive.
From his youth, he was known as a Hokkekyo jikyosha (devotee of the Lotus Sutra) belonging to the hijiri (wandering monk) group with a background of Mountain Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。「早くから」を具体的に若いころから，としました。系統はlineageよりも派と思われます。関係代名詞who以下のかかる場所がわかりづらいので，withで聖にかかるようにしました。
sen.e: From his youth, he was known as a Hokkekyo jikyosha (devotee of the Lotus Sutra) belonging to the hijiri (wandering monk) group with a background of Mountain Buddhism.

sen.j: 存命中から多くの霊験があったことが伝えられている。
sen.e: It is also said that he had worked many miracles since he was alive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。「存命中から霊験があった」は性空に霊験があったと考えられるので書き換えました。
sen.e: It is also said that he had worked many miracles since he was alive.

sen.j: 1007年（寛弘4年）、播磨国弥勒寺 (姫路市)で98歳（80歳）で亡くなった。
sen.e: In 1007, he died at the age of 98 (80) at Miroku-ji Temple in Harima Province (Himeji City).
In 1007, he died at the age of 98 (80) at Miroku-ji Temple in Harima Province (now Himeji City).
sen.cmt: "he"の前のダブルスペースを訂正しました。"now Himeji City"とし現在の・・のニュアンスをだしました。
sen.e: In 1007, he died at the age of 98 (80) at Miroku-ji Temple in Harima Province (now Himeji City).
